definition: to take unfair advantage of/to deceive/to cheat
to approach/to rise high/thick ice/to insult or maltreat

sentences.english: Cyberbullying is a problem no one knows how to fix.
sentences.chinese: 网络欺凌就目前阶段是难以解决的问题。

sentences.english: Today we have the last of three reports on bullying.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我们在过去的三个欺凌的报告。

sentences.english: We can buy many kinds of ice-creams in the frozen food section in supermarkets.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以在超市的冷冻食品区买到很多种类的冰欺凌。

sentences.english: As a roaring lion, and a hungry bear, so is a wicked prince over the poor people.
sentences.chinese: 暴君欺凌贫穷弱小，有如咆哮怒狮，饥饿野熊。

sentences.english: We have three flavors of ice-cream,vanilla chocolate and strawberry.
sentences.chinese: 我们有三种口味的冰欺凌，香草，巧克力和草莓。

sentences.english: The changes were unveiled during a White House anti-bulling conference.
sentences.chinese: 白宫的一个反欺凌会议中公开了这些变化。

sentences.english: Have you been the victim of Cyberbullying?
sentences.chinese: 你曾经是网络欺凌之受害者？
以学校为基础的反欺凌预防项目。

sentences.english: And like so many other Gypsy children, they faced bullying.
sentences.chinese: 如其他的许多吉普赛孩子一样，他们也遭受欺凌。

definition: see 恃強欺弱|恃强欺弱[shi4 qiang2 qi1 ruo4]
to use one's strength to bully the weak (idiom)
